intro: Euphrasia tirolensis, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. Euphrasia tirolensis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
